characters: SHE FLOATS UPWARDS. THE CAMERA BREAKS THE SURFACE OF THE
SHOWING THE BACK OF THE ROOM
BERRISFORD'S SILENT IMAGE ON A VIDEO SCREEN
ETHEREAL SITAR MUSIC UP OVER THE FOLLOWING SEQUENCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A serene landscape, mist collecting as the red ball of a dips behind the mountains. In the middle of a field stands a bare-chested man facing sunset. He is HARRIS, forty-ish, greying but handsome, an very fit. His hands are outstretched as if embracing an invisible entity. He seems filled with some sort of transcendental power. Now, an air of fulfillment and reso settles over him. He turns and walks away from us. CAMERA ADJUSTS and reveals--

dialogues.speaker: SUNSET
dialogues.text: Once the home of Victorian Gentry, a few seasons of amate repair work have not compensated for decades of neglect. now as Harris walks towards it, the fading daylight and l shadows turn it into a fantasy castle. MUSIC ECHOES faint from within; it's "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" by Iron Butterfly. the music didn't place the era for us, the battered VW MINIBUS parked outside the house does; it's covered with flower paintings, slogans, and the ubiquitous peace sign. As Harris approaches the house, a dozen or so YOUNG PEOPL rush to greet him and embrace him. Extending his arms out enclose them all, he goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was probably a stately parlor in its day. There is a funky assembly of odd handmade furniture. There are musli curtains on the windows, crude paintings, and quilts cove ripped chairs and couches. Despite the squalor, there is neatness to the place. Now, the CAMERA begins to ROAM through the room and down the hallways lined with fading wallpaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (various)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --where did she go...? ... was here a moment ago... Cynthia, come on, honey, we need you... Cynthia, come out, come out wherever you are... the sun's going down, we're losing the moment...!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hey, mellow out, we got ten minutes, I like, checked the almanac, okay...? Ready or not, here we come... All these comments are made in relaxed and good natured tones. Finally the CAMERA PANS OVER to a little storage alcove beneath the servant's stairway. A HAND reaches in opens the door, and inside we SEE cartons, antique toys.. and then CYNTHIA, a pretty 13 year old girl who wears fun clothing and a haunted, nervous expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...There you are, you naughty girl! You almost made us lose the sunset... Come on, honey, time's wasting... She shrinks back from the HANDS that are pulling her up a out, but they prevail, and she's up and on unsteady feet. The CAMERA stays with her as she's led back down the hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faintly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please... I... I really don't want to do this... Can't I just wait for you..? I--I'm not sure about this-- A SET OF HANDS moves in, separates Cynthia from the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revealing VICTOR, a handsome youth a few years older than Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Cyn, easy. You don't want to do this, that's okay... right, Harris? The VOICES stop as everyone awaits an answer. CAMERA PANS across the common room, to the end we haven't seen yet. In the center of the room is a big cistern or font. As we watch, Harris has just DUNKED someone in it. The person steps out, laughing, sloshing in amber liquid. Standing around are other people, some already dripping wet, other awaiting their turns. Some are clothed and wet, others in varying degrees of undress. It all seems slightly off, slightly eerie, despite their smiles and cheer. Harris splashes himself with the amber liquid from the tub, push his hair back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Victor, it's not okay. Here at Unity House, some things have to be done... (slight smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in Unity. This is one of them. He WADES CLOSER to the CAMERA, within reach of Cynthia, Victor and the others. Smiles again. It's the kind of a smile that inspires trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, do you trust me? She nods immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And have I ever lied to you? She shakes her head. He GESTURES. The people around Cynth begin to GET INTO the tub. Some remove their clothing; others get in clothes and all. Toddlers and infants are h by their parents and playfully splashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I say to you now... to all of you now... that this will be the Ultimate Joining... of man and woman... parent and child... humanity and Godhead. He looks at Victor, who reluctantly lets Cynthia's hand g gets in. Now only Cynthia remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia. Come. There is no shame in this. No crime. No sin. Just the final break with the old world... As night falls, we start a new day... a day of Unity. (a command, but warm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to me... my lovechild.

dialogues.speaker: ON CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: His last words melt her remaining resistance. Moving like sleepwalker, she steps into the tub, wades forward. Then stops, looks down at the fluid lapping at her jeans... ru her hand through it. Her eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun almost gone now, red light reflecting on the gabl windows. Even the battered VW van looks good in this setting. It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   No... HARRIS' VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, come back! We can't do it without you... We must have unity, my lovechild... Unity, now and through eternity... Cynthia, you cannot run... You belong to us forever--! Pause. The faint SOUNDS of SPLASHING and then FOOTSTEPS skittering on tired wooden floors... and then--

dialogues.speaker: EXPLOSION
dialogues.text: WINDOWS blow out. Splintered BEAMS propeller through the air. The VW camper on the lawn ROCKS with the shock wave. Then a SECOND EXPLOSION blows the Victorian cupolas and widow's walk off the roof. From somewhere in the distance HEAR SIRENS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE is CONSUMING what's left of the building. Rescue workers and firefighters are running back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR WASSERMAN
dialogues.text: A plainclothes detective, he NODS to some uniforms, steps around some debris to move closer to the scene. He puts h collar up against the SPRAY which leaks from firehose connections. Seeing one of his men, he SHOUTS over the di WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have we got? POLICEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-four bodies, Inspector. Maybe more.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As he says this, both men watch as firefighters carry out SCORCHED AND BLACKENED CORPSE that looks like a 3,000 yea old mummy.

dialogues.speaker: CORPSE
dialogues.text: It's set down on the ground beside other blackened bodies partially covered by tarps. As the body is set down it CRUNCHES, and a piece BREAKS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Wasserman blanches, wipes his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause of fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kind of explosion... gas main, methane, too soon to tell. God only knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope He doesn't keep it to Himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got one! We got a survivor! Get a stretcher and oxygen over here, STAT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasserman and the cop run up the slope with the others.

dialogues.speaker: RUINS
dialogues.text: Medics run around the parked VW, which drips water and chemical foam. Rescue workers move a FALLEN BEAM and pull soot-blackened form out of a hole. As the CAMERA PUSHES closer, we see that it is Cynthia. Her clothes are torn a singed, and she is unconscious, but as they work on her w see that she is largely unharmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (busy, frantic) Make room, make room! Get that airway in! I got a pulse, whoa, it's faint... Talk about lucky, she musta fallen in the basement... First and second degree burns... Come on people, move your asses!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wasserman tries to keep up as they carry her on a stretch towards an ambulance, put her inside. It ROARS AWAY, SIRE WAILING. MUSIC COMES UP AND OVER-- it's MAGIC CARPET RIDE Steppenwolf. NEWSCASTER'S VOICE (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Authorities continue to investigate yesterday's mysterious explosion and fire at Unity House, the controversial New Age commune headed by self-styled Guru Adrian Harris. 32 people died in the blaze. Thirteen year old Cynthia Weston, the fire's only survivor, remains in guarded but stable condition at County General. In national news, newspaper heiress Patricia Hearst was abducted from her Bay area apartment shortly before dawn today... A communique from the so-called "Symbionese Liberation Army" demanded that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors CRASH ASIDE as Cynthia is rushed in on a gurney The CEILING LIGHTS flicker past us as they move her into emergency room. VOICES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood pressure 90 over 30, we're losing her... Where's that cart? CLEAR! CLEAR! Okay, it's climbing... Watch the EEG... Brain activity, shit, damn low... We begin a SERIES OF DISSOLVES, including: A) WASSERMAN, who appears first in his clothes from the fire, then two other wardrobe changes; B) HOSPITAL PERSONNEL, at first the harried and rushed emergency staff, and then the more blase regular doctors and nurses; C) VARIOUS MEDICAL EQUIPMENT, as a series of DIAGNOSTIC TESTS are run on Cynthia--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: D) CYNTHIA, first in her fire-scorched clothing, then as it is cut away, and then in several HOSPITAL GOWNS, first white, then green, then blue... E) A SERIES OF HOSPITAL ROOMS AND LABS; P) HOSPITAL CHARTS AND FILES, with ever-changing DATES;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over this) No sign of physical damage but neurological functions still depressed... Sorry, Inspector, no changes... Patient comatose after 14 days... Brain scan shows minor irregularities; pupil function within normal range... Still no sign of consciousness... Still comatose after 21 days ... Sorry, Inspector, we'll call you if there's any progress... Still comatose after 42 days... Patient moved out of intensive care....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the MONTAGE CONTINUES, TITLES BEGIN. Now we HEAR VARIO NEWS BROADCASTS which come UP AND OVER, fading IN AND OUT with the medical VOICES. (If desired, TV NEWSCASTS might seen as well on a hospital room's set.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered, in and out, intermittently audible) ...The mother of Martin Luther King Junior was assassinated today while she played the organ in her son's church... interrupt to bring this bulletin... Richard Milhous Nixon has resigned as President of the United States... As the Marine guards hold back the crowds, the last helicopters took off from the roof of the Embassy in Saigon... Bicentennial festivities begin today in Philadelphia...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We SEE Cynthia in her bad, always in the same near-fetal position. The only changes are the occasionally different hues of her blankets and the varying length of her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --leak at the Three Mile Island facility... 73 Americans remain hostage in the Teheran Embassy... Ronald Reagan has been elected 40th President... renewed fighting in the Middle East... assailant shot John Lennon at point blank range... President Reagan has been shot! He is in guarded condition at... The Pope has been shot! He was rushed by ambulance to... President Anwar Sadat has been assassinated...

dialogues.speaker: 14A BERRISFORD
dialogues.text: We SEE several SHOTS of this man, first as a white-coated RESIDENT in his late 30's, walking past Cynthia's hospita doorway, and then stopping, curious, and looking in on he and then in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as (with changing wardrobe and increasing status) he chec in on the girl's unaltered condition as months and years continue to click by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the Korean airliner was shot down by a Soviet jet, killing all 269 people aboard... invasion of the island Nation of Grenada... Prime Minister Indira Ghandi was assassinated by members of her own bodyguard... the PLO hijackers shot the wheelchair-bound American and threw his body overboard... Space Shuttle Challenger exploded moments after launch... renewed fighting today in the Middle East... President Corazon Aquino asked the soldiers to lay down their arms... Senator Gary Hart withdrew from the race... Fawn Hall... Lieutenant Colonel Oliver North... Contrascam Investigation... PTL scandal... munitions train severed the lag of a protester at the... renewed fighting in the Middle East...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HEAD NURSE looks up, smiles at a YOUNG FLOOR NURSE as walks past. From somewhere we HEAR a Springsteen song on radio. HEAD NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie. What happened to your windsurfing lesson? YOUNG NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wind. I changed shifts with Nancy. (picking up charts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... time to weed the vegetable patch. We FOLLOW the young nurse as she goes into--

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Bored, the nurse goes to the foot of the bad, checks the chart there. She moves past MONITORING EQUIPMENT which sh only subtle movement. As she begins to take Cynthia's blo pressure, CAMERA CONTINUES ON INTO THE BED and we see Cynthia, She is now a fully grown young woman in her late 20's. is curled up in a fetal ball.

dialogues.speaker: THE YOUNG NURSE
dialogues.text: finishes her work and then gathers some bottles from the table. She goes to the door and then REACTS to a SOUND. She looks around, puzzled. Meanwhile, we SEE (and she DOESN'T) that there is INCREASED ACTIVITY on the monitors CYNTHIA (faint, weak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no... it's wrong... someone... please help... YOUNG NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit... Stunned, the nurse DROPS the bottles with a CRASH. Recovering her composure, she darts back to the bed, watc flabbergasted as Cynthia continues to STIR, her arms weak battling half-realized fears.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The young nurse hits an ALARM, grabs Cynthia's arms to prevent her from pitching out of the bed, and then DOCTOR and NURSES are scrambling all over the room, and as the D RISES we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBULBS pop and the HOSPITAL SPOKESMAN grins clumsily, famous for fifteen minutes. There's eight or nine reporters here, all of them wishing they were on bigger stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mid speech) Twelve years, two months...   nine days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that like a world record for a coma or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, no. The longest one on record is 37 years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first reporter closes a notebook, leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she remember anything about the fire at Universe House?

dialogues.speaker: SHOWING THE BACK OF THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Lieutenant (nГ©e Inspector) Wasserman is there.    He's g paunchier, but the raincoat is the same one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting) Unity House. No, she appears to have no memory of the accident itself or the days leading up to it. It's not uncommon after serious trauma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens to her now? Have her family or friends been notified?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stopped looking for any family ton years ago.. Right now we"re planning to transfer Cynthia to Dr. S.A. Berrisford's Neuropsychiatric Clinic. It's right here on our grounds, and Dr. Berrisford is familiar with both the neuromuscular problems a patient like this will encounter as well as the inevitable mental readjustment that will be required. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reporters filter out. Wasserman is already gone.

dialogues.speaker: FOOT
dialogues.text: as it is clumsily set down...    another FOOT slides forw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is standing inside a set of parallel bars. She's pale, weak looking. A PHYSICAL THERAPIST is at her elbow, egging her on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... Very good... Come on, just a few more steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia blinks, as if just processing the therapist's wor takes some adjustment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weary) I... I can't... I have to rest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young lady, you've had fifteen years of rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA ADJUSTS to show DR. BERRISFORD. In his 50's, avuncular, he wears half-framed glasses and a sweater ves under his medical coat. Two pieces of tissue paper mark h razor's passage on his neck.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BERRISFORD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now walk to the end of that platform, or you won't got any chocolate ice cream. Something about Berrisford's mock-stern tone bores in on Cynthia, gets a reaction. She gropes for an answer. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) I... I hate chocolate ice cream. BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then walk to the end of the platform, or I'll shove an entire gallon down your throat. Cynthia's eyes crinkle with confusion. And then, ah, she gets it! A joke, the first one in over a decade. She SMILES, and it's a beautiful smile. Setting her jaw, she makes a renewed effort and reaches the and of the platfor The therapist and Berrisford both move quickly to catch h and set her down in a wheelchair. BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the therapist) That'll be all. Berrisford begins wheeling Cynthia along. They leave the therapy room, go down a corridor. (Note: Passage as per location.) As they go by other patients and staff, there' general BUZZ as people whisper about Cynthia. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peering at Berrisford) Am I supposed to know you or something? BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've looked in on you from time to time... but that's hardly an introduction. You've been transferred into my care, Cynthia. I*m Doctor S. A. Berrisford, Consulting Chief of Neuropsychiatry and head of the Berrisford Clinic. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fumbling it) C-consulting Cheev-- Chief of--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, forget all that.   Just call me what my staff does. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. Cynthia LAUGHS. She likes this man's directness, the way doesn't condescend to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berrisford parks her and site down across from her. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what kind of doctor did you say you were? Berrisford notices one of the tissues on his neck.    Sco flicks it away. BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, I'm not a surgeon. (as she laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a psychiatrist. CYNTHIA (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I need a psychiatrist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, you've been out of touch with reality for over ten years. Your recovery goes beyond your muscle tone... You have to ease into life... into interacting with other people again. Into a world that's changed so much that sometimes I get confused by it. (taking out an appointment book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, my assistant Dr. Goldman has a group therapy session every day... I'm putting you down for it, starting tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure) Group therapy? But--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Berrisford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revealing Wasserman.    He shows his badge to the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Lieutenant Wasserman. I left a message with your secretary...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising, meeting him halfway) And I left one with your desk sergeant. (a hard whisper) I told you this would have to wait. You shouldn't even be here--

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: She can't help but listen as they continue in lowered ton

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've waited fifteen years. That's long enough. Now I want to speak with Miss Weston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Weston is still recovering and is in no condition for a prolonged interrogation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tight smile) Then don't prolong it. I'll be brief with her, I'll be gentle with her--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let you know when she's ready--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E--excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and look at her. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Berrisford, what's this all about...? This man wants to talk to me...? Berrisford starts to answer, but Wasserman rushes in. WASSERMAN (quietly, slowly, as if to a child)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Miss Weston. I just have a few easy, simple questions. (patient, phony smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About you... and about Unity House. Cynthia looks at him strangely, turns to Berrisford. CYNTHIA (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he talking like that? Is he one of your patients? Wasserman burns.   Berrisford LAUGHS. BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Wasserman is a police officer. And the word "patience" isn't part of his vocabulary. Wasserman scowls, not enjoying being the butt of a joke. resumes his normal tons, which is far from diplomatic. WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Weston. What's the last thing you remember before... CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Before the accident?   Nothing. WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how do you know it was an accident? BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember... a beautiful sunset. Harris, smiling at me... WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writing) Harris, he was the leader? Cynthia's eyes are far away.    The memories come back... words are slow, but vivid. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leader, founder... chief cook and bottlewasher... (smiling) Executive in charge of Dreaming. We were all together... all working to make a now world... That last night, there was a... (brow furrowing) Gathering... a... a sort of... baptism... And then... She winces, rubs her eyes. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, that's all I can see. WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Weston. This "Unity House"... was it a cult? CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     I don't understand the question. BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "cult," Cynthia. A syndrome of society you have been fortunate enough to miss. They're popular with impressionable people, the penny press... (pause) ...and lazy policemen who like to blame them for crimes they can't solve. Wasserman closes his notebook, gives Berrisford a cold st WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there that night, Doctor. I watched them stack those bodies... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: men, women, children. They looked like 2,000 year old mummies. They broke apart like 2,000 year old mummies. Cynthia gasps. WASSERMAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it was an accident... fine. If it wasn't... the person responsible could still be out there. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's probably as interested in Miss Weston's memory as I am. He turns, nods to Cynthia. WASSERMAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel better. He goes out.   Cynthia's breath comes in short gasps.   F she calms. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like that man. BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes two of us. He sits beside her again. BERRISFORD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as long as you're here... (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can keep him away. CAMERA TIGHTENS on Cynthia as she considers this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is cheery, commands a view of the city. A VIDEO CAMERA sits unobtrusively in one corner. Six people sit i chairs in various stages of interest and/or boredom. They are MIRIAM, an attractive woman in her forties, who chain-smokes designer cigarettes; CONNIE, smiling, chipper;

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ED, overweight, friendly; LANA, pale, worried looking; and GILDA, tiny, frightened, withdrawn. She sits with fee pulled up on her chair, arms wrapped around her knees. CAMERA ADJUSTS to show Cynthia driving her electric wheelchair into the room and into a place in the circle. RALPH stands. Long-haired, with the staccato delivery of stand-up comic, he smiles. RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now that we're all here, we can begin. Cynthia, I'm Dr. Goldman, and I'd like to welcome you to our little group. I don't know how much my colleague Dr. Berrisford has told you about my methods. I have my detractors... but I have my successes, too! We're going to get you out of your depression... We're going to got you out of your neurosises... We're going to got you out of that hideous hospital robe and into a flimsy revealing negligee--one with the little holes here? I can see us now on a desert island... You, me, a portable waterbed-- As Cynthia's eyes widen, DR. ALAN GOLDMAN comes into the room, sighs with weary familiarity at Ralph's antics. (Actually, Alan doesn't look much more like a doctor than Ralph.) ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, sit down and cut out the shit, okay? RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Goldman, I was on the verge of a major breakthrough, and you blew it! ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph? (when he sits) Cynthia. I'm Doctor Goldman--at least, last time I checked... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: and I doubt if my welcome can equal Ralph's, but I'll try. This is the Borderline Personality Group. And you are now a card-carrying member. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a borderline personality? MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask him. He's making this up as he goes along. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A borderline personality is one that can't be accurately placed on the Neurosis-Psychosis arc. As a personality syndrome it encompasses identity crises, chemical addictions, emotionalism, anxiety- RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing, SCREAMING like Sam Kinison) You forgot VIOLENT MOOD SWINGS! He sits, smiles sweetly. CONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He also forgot suicidal tendencies. But, as one whose previous reincarnations stretch back to Ancient Atlantis, well, suicide is meaningless anyway. ED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't forgot binge eating. (pause) Gourmet binge eating. MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly, to Cynthia) I told you he was making this up. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If everyone is finished-- LANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking in) They're not finished, Dr. Goldman, they won't be finished until they have her feeling as miserable and pathetic and confused as they are.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am confused-- LANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? (to the group) I hope you're all happy-- CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Goldman, I... I don't really know what I'm doing here. I mean... I don't think I meet your description of a Borderline Personality-- RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give yourself some time, Cynthia. We'll help you work on it. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and I don't really know what I'm doing here. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't Dr. Berrisford explain? CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he thought that this would help me... fit into the 80's. Miriam CRACKS UP. MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you want to fit into the 80's, you're already two divorces, one condo and a yeast infection behind. Why don't you just catch up with the 70's and move to Cleveland? ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I can offer a more practical suggestion... Why don't you talk, Cynthia? CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk...? ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About something close to you.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop beating around the fucking bush, Goldman! Just come out and ask her! LANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Miriam) Do you have to be so crude? MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Cynthia. Dish out the dirt. Tell us all about Unity House. (gesturing a marquee) The last gasp of the Age of Aquarius. Building a better world through... what? Chemistry? Good vibrations? Tie-dying your undies? CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to disappoint you. I don't have those kinds of stories. RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, Miriam. Cynthia, just tell us about the orgies. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, I'm going to bore you. She thinks for a minute, starts to speak. She's hesitant first, and then the old memories come forward. She's sincere, earnest... captivating. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we felt... what we believed... was that if people could become selfless enough, if they could free themselves from their egos, they would experience a... togetherness. A... oneness. A Unity. That's where the name came from. We had a dream about a perfect society based on trust. On love. On totally committed togetherness. We weren't trying to change the whole world. We were just trying to change each other. Pause.   Everyone is affected by her sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acting out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS everyone turns, astonished. Gilda gets out of her chai slowly walks towards Cynthia. Takes her hand. And smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. It didn't matter if it worked. All that mattered was... you tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched) Exactly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN from a TV SCREEN which shown the above moment.   As group session CONTINUES UNDER, CAMERA PANS to reveal Berrisford and Alan watching the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilda hasn't said three words in three weeks. And now, Cynthia comes in with this love, peace and Woodstock routine and... presto. Am I missing something, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's espousing a total belief system. A kind of holistic healing matrix not unlike the dynamic energy shift model. Isn't that interesting? They're adopting it, embracing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad we can't follow through on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Berrisford, the people in this group... some of them are deeply disturbed. Cynthia doesn't belong with them-- an experiment for one session, fine, but in the long run--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan. We've opened primary channels of communication. You've opened them, Alan. Let's not rush to throw away our progress. Neuroses are hardly contagious. A few weeks in the group won't hurt Cynthia. With luck, she'll overcome her memory trauma. That would mean progress... not to Mention getting Lieutenant Wasserman off my back. In the meantime...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, puts his hand on the younger man's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems to like you. See if you can get her to open up, and let's press on. (pause) With a united front?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A united front.   Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied, Berrisford smiles, goes out the door.     Alan and looks at Cynthia's image on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patients in different stages of fitness use the equipment some with supervision, others on their own. HETTIE, Berrisford's chief nurse--a Selma Diamond type--comes in a tray of medication in paper cups. She works her way ove to where

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: is doing log lifts on a bench. She's in a leotard and leg warmers, and there's real color in her face for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HETTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop down to first gear, honey. It's Miller time. She fumbles on her tray for the cup marked "Weston," hand the pills to Cynthia along with a cup of juice. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are these? Vitamins? HETTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty secrets from the orient. Look what they've done for me. Cynthia laughs, takes the pills. Hettie moves over to Ral who's just finished doing bench presses. HETTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, you in a cooperative mood, or do I have to tie you up again? RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promises, promises. He takes the pills she gives him, smiles.      She just l him, taps his mouth. HETTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open. Of course the pills are still under his tongue. Hettie gi him a shot in the solar plexus and he GULPS. Hettie hands him the juice. HETTIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time I hit lower. She moves on to other patients.     Ralph moves over to C RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's crazy about me. (watching Cynthia's workout)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming along. A regular Rocky. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky?   The flying squirrel? RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky the fighting Stallone. (on her blank look) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: I keep forgetting you just left the Twilight Zone. Hey, why don't you come up to my room, and I'll bring you up to date. I've got a VHS VCR, a CD, and MTV. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making this up...      aren't you? He just grins. She slips down to the floor, does some stretching exercises. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a complicated world. How do you handle it? RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whenever it gets to be too much, I just let all of the negative stuff out of my body. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean with meditation, yoga, what? RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I just make a little hole and let it all escape. He pulls open his shirt. On his chest and arms are dozens scars in neat little rows. Cynthia swallows, stunned.      Nonplussed, Ralph buttons up. RALPH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh, here comes the assistant Ayatollah. See ya. As Ralph exits, Cynthia looks around, puzzled. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ay-a-toll-ah..?" Then she sees Alan. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy you some lunch? CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He starts to help her up.   She pushes him off gets up wi theatrical hop. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed. They walk out of the therapy room. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressed enough to call me a cab? ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I follow you. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been talking to Ralph. He told me about his... personal therapy program. (as Alan winces)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I've been watching the others... Dr. Goldman, they belong here. I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass Lana and Miriam who are swallowing medication f Hettie's tray. The two women patients wave at Cynthia, wh smiles. ALAN (as they walk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, call me Alan. Doctor Goldman is my father... (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and my grandfather. I think my first baby toy was a stethoscope-- CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're changing the subject... (trying it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Alan. I'm feeling stronger. I'm getting used to things like VC esses and MCDs. I want to leave. ALAN (carefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your parents died when you were a child. We haven't been able to locate any relatives. He stops at the elevator doors, hits the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'd just look up some of the old hands from Unity House... crash with them for a while... (thinking) ...do people still say "crash"--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia... (gently) There aren't any old hands left. The fire that injured you...? It took everyone also with it. They're all gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia reacts as if struck...    has to loan against the to catch her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew there were deaths...   but... everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so. Look, Cynthia... I'm not saying this to upset you, but the sooner you realize that that whole phase of your life is over, and move on, the better off you're going to be. Why don't you bring this into the open... talk about it in group? Oh, here's our ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saying this, he turns as an elevator OPENS.      It's pre crowded. He holds the door for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Talk about it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing he's waiting, she straightens, moves into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could somebody hit one?   Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to him) "Talk about it in group." Is that the answer to everything around here? The doors CLOSE. Everyone huddles in the compact space silently, politely. The elevator heaves into movement. HUMS as it whisks down the shaft. The overhead fluorescent light in the car is weak.    It flickers off and on momentarily. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody ever said it would be easy. And it works for a lot of people. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) It's not working for Ralph... or his chest. (pleading tone) Can't you at least transfer me... get me in a group of people with problems a little more like mine-- ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, we don't have a lot of patients who've been in a coma for over a decade! The light gets weaker. Finally it just goes out.     Ther general SIGH of annoyance from the passengers. The light FLICKERS on every few seconds giving off the ef of a strobe light. A PASSENGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think with what they charge here they could pay their electric bills LAUGHTER. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. They're probably giving shock therapy. (for Alan's benefit) "It works for most people". More LAUGHTER. Then Cynthia is RIVETED by the sight of something across the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In the LIGHT of the next strobe like FLASH, we see HARRIS He is staring at Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: ON CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: Staggered, disbelievingly, she moves behind Alan, looks o to the far corner again. Another FLASH. Harris is gone. Suddenly the ELEVATOR JERK TO A HALT, but the doors DON'T OPEN. Passengers GROAN, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The emergency BELL starts sounding. Cynthia, still confus gets shoved against the back wall as the passengers busy themselves pushing buttons. Cynthia bumps into the man next to her.        She looks FLASH.   It is Harris. FLASH. Harris reaches out to Cynthia. She CRIES OUT, jerk away, slamming into Alan, falling to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, lady, relax! We're on the ground floor--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me out! Let me out--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH. Cynthia is on the floor. She raises her head. Someone is on the floor right across from her. FLASH.   It's Harris.    His face is burned and skeletal. GRINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unity, Cynthia...   Now and forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has no eyelids or lips. Cynthia SCREAMS, struggles to feet, knocking over another passenger. Now it's chaos in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me out, let me out!   Alan, help, help--!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HARRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, you cannot run...      You belong to us Forever--!

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Struggles across the crowded elevator, catches her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia..? The elevator doors suddenly OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia literally TUMBLES out of the elevator, staggers a the wall, holding herself up. Alan runs out to aid her. T passengers get off the elevator, looking at her oddly. A CUSTODIAN runs up and turns off the alarm. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, what happened--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him!     It's him!   He's alive-- ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's alive? CYNTHIA (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alive! Right over-- She stops. The elevator is open and empty. The passengers watch her, some concerned, some voyeuristic. Now they dri away. CYNTHIA (CONT'D) (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --there... Alan just stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berrisford sits, listens intently to Alan.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --hallucination, flashback, I don't know what to call it- BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about psychotic episode? ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, she doesn't fit the pattern-- BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Addictive personalities can be borderline. You know that-- ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patiently) She has no history of drug abuse-- BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's other kinds of addictions. (standing, pensive) we see it in these fringe religious groups... these instant creeds with pseudo-Messianic delusions. You've heard how she talks about Unity House? Perhaps that's her drug. Perhaps she's going through a--withdrawal of sorts. Her memory lapses about Unity House are equally symptomatic... There's some violent turmoil under that pretty little facade. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) You put her in the Borderline Group and she became one? BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. CAMERA TIGHTENS ON HIM. BERRISFORD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe she went into that coma a disturbed young lady. Fifteen years later... nothing has changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can read the name on the locked security door (albeit backwards.) A SECURITY GUARD watches a basketball game on portable set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not the room we saw when she was comatose, but a brighter, more residential arrangement. Cynthia sits on t bed, watches as Hettie counts out pills for her. Cynthia swallows them, hesitates at a red one. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's new. HETTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll help you sleep. (explaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of a post-elevator cocktail? Cynthia scowls, takes it. Hettie goes out. Cynthia lies down on the bed, stiff. Turns over once or twice. Sighing she picks up the TV remote, shakes her head at the myriad buttons. Finally she finds the right one, CLICKS IT. 39   TV - HER P.O.V. She's come in on the middle of a group therapy scene from BOB NEWHART SHOW. (NOTE: Or maybe THE SNAKE PIT or SHOCK

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: She watches until she realizes what it is, then CLICKS it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hettie leans over the security guard's desk. The guard GROANS in frustration an the basketball game ends. HETTIE (extending her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay up. Twenty bucks. Neither notices a DARK FIGURE passing by close to the CAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia lies restlessly in her bed. She hears footsteps coming closer. They stop at her door. She looks over. There is a SHADOW moving in the crack under the door.   T doorknob TURNS. Cynthia sits up. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there? She reaches for the button to call the nurse, but then th door is OPEN, and the figure stands there silhouetted. FIGURE (whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia? The figure comes forward. Cynthia backs off the other sid of the bed and turns on a light. It is Victor, the boy we remember from the opening scene. The years have been kind to him. He stands there, the dim light spilling on his Army field jacket and bell-bottomed jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia?   It's me.   Victor. CYNTHIA (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vic? Oh, my God-- She practically leaps across the room, hugs him with all strength. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. (marveling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Cyn. (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so little anymore. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vic, this is just... fantastic, it's the most incredible... (hesitating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... how can you be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   It is after visiting hours--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean... they said that...      that everybody died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Do I look like a ghost to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rapid-fire) How did you survive? How did you find me? Is anyone else--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa. It's a long story... (looking around) Let me tell it somewhere else. I feel like I'm in, like, the Pentagon or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia grins, grabs a light jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's go AWOL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor peeks out the door. An orderly passes, then disappears. Victor and Cynthia tiptoe out, sprint down th corridor to a stairwell marked "EXIT", and they are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor takes her hand, and they run towards a battered VW van. We recognize it and its slogans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke!   You've still got Zeke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs her hand along the dusty side lovingly, and then they hop inside.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE REAR LICENSE PLATE
dialogues.text: Rusted, dated 1973.     The van DRIVES AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a tacky but cozy building, circa 1958. "Zeke" pulls rattling to a coughing halt. They get out, head up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come in, turning on lights. It's a dingy couple of rooms, but lush with its variety of objects. Everything looks like it came from the Age of Aquarius: beanbag furniture, paper "Tiffany" shades on hanging lights, blacklight posters, hanging macrame planters. Cynthia loves the room and everything in it. But she is particularly drawn to a canvas on an easel in the far cor

dialogues.speaker: PAINTING
dialogues.text: It's of her, sitting serenely in a meadow, the Unity Hous perched prominently on a hill in the distance. (In the doorway, the bare-chested FIGURE of a man may--or may not barely visible.) Cynthia's clothes in the painting are th ones she wore in the opening scene. But her face is that of today's Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... did it by memory. I tried to imagine... what you'd... look like today. Guess I came pretty close. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. More beautiful than I ever was. VICTOR (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you need a new mirror. she smiles, flattered.    Suddenly a CAT jumps up on a cr VICTOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Chairman Meow. Cynthia picks him up.    Victor takes out a bottle of teq and two glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still haven't told me how you lived. I really can't remember anything about the... accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stiffens.    His eyes are far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people back then, they hated Unity House. Hated Harris and his dreams... dreams of peace... of oneness. That hate fed negative energy into the cosmic vortex... Something bad was bound to happen. That hate was so strong... so envious of what we had...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has SQUEEZED the shot glass in his hand so hard that i EXPLODES. Cynthia JUMPS, and that's when he notices it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very normal) Oh, fuck--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've cut yourself--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes over, binds his hand with a dishcloth.     He h onto her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess talking about the past can be a little dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours a shot into the remaining glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's drink to the present. (pause) To us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SIPS.   Passes the glass to her.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: She hesitates...    smiles.   Drinks. There is a drop of blood in the glass.     She doesn't se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To us.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: VICTOR (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To... Unity. He pulls her close. They KISS... she seems to malt in his grasp. The cat jumps down. Slowly they kiss and touch eac other. They stop and stare into each other's eyes. He moves his hand over her shoulders, neck, through her h She is completely his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a dozen candles illuminate the room. Cynthia and Victor are making love. Not violent, but slow passionate, dreamlike. They are completely enjoying each other. The satisfaction seems spiritual. They stare into each other's eyes the entire time. They are lost. Gradually Victor's rhythm builds. As his momentum increas as the ecstasy nears, Cynthia accelerates too. Heaving, gasping, they are approaching a beautiful climax. But just when it seems Victor is on the verge, the very threshold, he stops and JUMPS violently out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor? Victor paces around the room, practically bouncing off th walls. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. I can't believe it. What a great idea...! Too amazing! Too amazing! CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not wrong, Cynthia...right! The most right thing in the world! He goes to his closet and pulls out a shoe box. He holds with a coy expression, like a kid hiding a frog. Cynthia' annoyance with the break in mood fades in light of his exuberance. Their tone with each other remains loving, kidding. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to tell me your little secret, or should I just got dressed? VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Cyn, but I just got the most incredible idea. It's absolutely beautiful! Do you want to know what it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! He sits on the bad. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just thinking about what we were doing here together... CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should hope so... VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't it be incredible if, right at the perfect moment right when we're coming, if we did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did what? VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we were meant to do, of course. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) ...meant to do...?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sunset. That last night.      At Unity House. Remember? CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...     No, Victor, I don't... VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant) They all got to go. You and me... we got left behind... while they went on. (chuckling) Guess that's why they say life ain't fair. Well... He opens the box.    Inside it are TWO PISTOLS. VICTOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --we can fix that. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stiffening) My God, Victor! Put those away-- He ignores her, checks the cylinder on the revolver, the on the automatic. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so great! I mean, I've been living with all this shit, thinking about you, searching... going nowhere. And you, hell, you don't fit in with Ralph and Miriam, those other flakes... Berrisford and Goldman, they're a waste of time-- CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-how do you know about them? I never-- He SLAMS the clip home, CLOSES the cylinder. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We had the answers, way back then. Unity. Unity, now and forever. Cynthia, this is our second chance! She shrinks away from him on the bed. He bounces closer l a kid at a pajama party, holds out one of the pistols.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VICTOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you do me, and I'll do you-- but wait until I say go! Hey, get rid of the sheet... Let me see that grown up body... He grins, puts the gun to her head and gets an top of her CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Vic. Please.       Please!   I don't want to do this! VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you do. You know you do. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! He's holding her down.   He's getting into it. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Cynthia, it's so beautiful. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, God, no-- VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the edge of space and time. He spreads her legs under the sheets. She's struggling against him, but it's no use. He's too strong. He's comin closer. VICTOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good... good... ummm... ummm... (continuing) Cynthia, it's happening. Put the gun to my head. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Vic, no! VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, oh yeah...     oh, YEAH-- A SHOT sounds.   She SCREAMS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia BOLTS up out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! The candles are out.    Victor isn't in the room. Cynthia, drenched with sweat, slowly catches her breath. looks around, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vic? She goes into the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Vic. It is dark except for a FIRE in the fireplace. Th flames REFLECT oddly on the slick surface of the oil pain of Unity House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vic? She checks in the kitchen. Nothing.       She looks back bedroom. The apartment is empty. She's just calming when--MEEOW! The CAT LEAPS out of nowhere, startling her, and then running out of sight. She swallows. Very nervous now, she sits on the couch and starts pulling on her jeans and shoes. The CAMERA MOVES AROUND her, revealing the entire apartment. We see EVERY ANGLE. It is completely quiet and still. The CAMERA SETTL at one ANGLE on Cynthia. A shadow behind her MOVES. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Cynthia JUMPS from fright. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Vic. I thought you... left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?    Leave you all alone? He pulls her into his arms.      She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vic?   Vic, are you... happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That... (kissing her) ...has to be.. (kissing again) ...the stupidest question I ever heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps kissing, caressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean... with... life.   With... being alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her oddly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relaxing) Never mind... I had this... bizarre dream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches her soft face. He runs his hands down her neck They kiss again, she now completely without reservation. Their embrace is so all-encompassing that, when she opens eyes, it's only then that she SEES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is kissing a BURNED AND SCARRED FACE WITH ONLY CLUMPS PUPPY BLACK MUSCLE HANGING ON THE BONE. It is Harris' fac the face we saw in the elevator. Cynthia GASPS, fumbles backwards off of the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back up at him.     He's Victor again, normal a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knocks over a tequila bottle. It's spilled all over t floor. She is speechless. He picks the bottle up.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VICTOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you pull away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...    I think I'd better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? She's over by the door.    Victor comes and presses again so she can't get out. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please let me out. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand...    What did I do? CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's not you, it...     it's me. I just want to go. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, maybe you belong in that clinic, because this, this is crazy! We were having a good time-- (on her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Look, what we were feeling... it was special. She softens-- VICTOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it was Unity. (distantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unity, Now and through Eternity... Cynthia, you cannot run... That does it.    Pale, she scrabbles at the doorknob, ope runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot run... You belong to us Forever--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs out of the building, past "Zeke."      She looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor is in the window waving, firelight dancing behind The reflection on the glass makes the painting on the wal look totally aflame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia has her thumb out as the cars whizz by.     One s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sweaty-looking DRIVER eyes Cynthia.   She just looks of depressed and afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets out of the car and goes in the main entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes her way to her room looking tired, distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lies on her bed, exhausted, trying to sleep.     She She gets out of bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's looking for an office. She goes in one marked Dr. Goldman. He looks up from his coffee, sees her ashen expression... pulls out a chair. Listens as the words tumble out. His expression changes... to skepticism... an then, as she breaks down SOBBING, to concern. He holds her... thinks... ...reaches for his car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are travelling along the highway.      Cynthia POINT turns onto another street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull up in front, park.     Go inside. CAMERA LINGERS long enough for us to notice a puddle from OIL LEAK exactly where "Zeke" was parked. THE MUSIC FADES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MANAGER, a fat woman in a muumuu, waddles ahead of th a huge keychain CLINKING with each of her steps. MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apartment 2-B, right? Alan looks at Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2B or not 2B, that is the question. She chuckles at her own wit, arrives at the door.      Op

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step inside. The place is completely bare.       No furniture. Nothing. Cynthia is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B..but...     it... it's empty! MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it is. I     don't show rented apartments.     Anyway, what you see is what you    get... one bedroom, gas range,    yadda yadda yadda. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Supposed to be six months minimum, but you seem like nice kids, so if you want a month to month, we can work it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This... this is impossible... Alan, I was here... He was here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is staggering around the room, looking everywhere She stares long and hard at a DUST-FREE rectangle where t painting... ...might have been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the manager) How long has this place been vacant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout six weeks. Couple a deadbeats... their damn kids tore the hell out of it, too--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan, I don't care what she says, this is it! Look, look-- (pointing) There's a double-door closet in there on the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks and sees the closet as she described it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he comes back out) Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, a double closet isn't exactly a positive I.D.--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you two talking about? You wanna rent, or what?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cynthia looks around, suddenly points to a stain on the r triumphant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! There, look--that's where I spilled the tequila... (on her knees, desperate) See? See? It's still wet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetic) Hon, I think that's from the ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TILTS UP. There is, indeed, a corresponding damp s directly above the one on the rug. As we WATCH a DRIP plo down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...damn plumber was supposed to fix it last week. (smiling) So! We in business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasserman SLAMS his hand down on the desk, furious. Cynth JUMPS, squeezes Alan's hand. Berrisford sits quietly, lea forward and picks up the pan holder Wasserman has displac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve hours! You wait twelve hours to tell me about this? Am I supposed to be grateful for your civic-mindedness? I told you the Unity House case was still open-- (pointing at Cynthia) --and she's the only lead. You should have called me the minute you found out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Found out what? Lieutenant, if I called the police every time one of my patients experienced a fantasy or a delusion, you'd have to move in here--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharp, stepping forward) It was not a delusion! Victor Lunes was here-- BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guard didn't see anyone-- CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the security guard needs glasses! Alan, tell them-- ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the spot) The apartment did match her general description-- WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a one bedroom flat with a beige rug... that's rather... generic. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Victor isn't generic-- WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor is dead! Dead for fifteen years-- CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --you've seen his body? WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it was burned beyond recognition-- but there was I.D.-- CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it--I knew it- ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia. Look... we've all done it... tumbled out of bed positive that we've just lived something that was only a dream-- CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) Damn it, it wasn't a dream--I was out there--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's denying you flow the coop, Miss Weston... You wanna prove the rest? Lemme get a policewoman to stand by while a gynecologist checks out your plumbing. We'll see soon enough if your ghost left a calling card-- Cynthia hauls off and gives Wasserman a tremendous SLAP. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard. She goes to the door, looks at the doctors. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... (searching) --experts! She goes out, SLAMS the door.    Wasserman rubs his jaw, his mouth. BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful! Wonderful! I've been waiting and waiting for her to finally show real anger--real emotion! This could be a breakthrough! (sincere) Thank you, Lieutenant. Wasserman holds a filling in his fingertips. WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   Anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS past a row of PILLOWS. We WIDEN, see that eac member of the group has a big pillow in front of them. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. First off, we're all going to feel a little silly and maybe look a little silly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a la Groucho) Especially in that shirt you're wearing, Goldman...

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: She sits, looking very distracted. As Alan continues speaking, he occasionally looks at her, but--to her relie deliberately doesn't single her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused, but pushing on) --but this technique works, and we're going to release some of our hidden aggression. Who's going to go first? Lana?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) How many helpless goose had to die to fill those stupid pillows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as everyone groans) None, Lana. They're polyester. Ed? Want to start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. Let's talk about the geese again. Nice fat ones, with all the trimmings--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, how about if we all start together and eliminate the wimp factor. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts POUNDING his pillow with a steady beat. Gradual self-consciously, the others JOIN in except for Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing, walking around the circle) Okay. What are we feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she pounds) We used to do something like this in the royal palace in Atlantis. But we used bags of dried kelp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brain is a bag of dried kelp--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chiding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph. Miriam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pounding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretending this is my first husband... No, maybe my third... (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a baseball bat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, people, let's work at being serious. He moves behind Cynthia, who's still unmoving.   Leans cl whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you had a rough night.   But you have to participate. She sighs, starts to pound the pillow. At first she's ver distracted, but then she gets into an unconscious rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: 70B GROUP
dialogues.text: All of them are finally and legitimately exorcising perso demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's better. Now let's hear some emotion. Let it out. yell! Scream! Miriam gives a very theatrical scream. There's some laughter, but others try, too. Gilda begins to give littl angry yelps. Ralph is really punching some ancient enemy. Connie does a respectable if modest SCREAM. Ed SNARLS wit more anger than we'd expect.

dialogues.speaker: 70B CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: begins hitting the pillow with growing strength. Her eyes are far away. She begins to BREATHE HEAVILY. CAMERA TIGHTENS ON HER. She closes her eyes. When she opens them she REACTS TO--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene in exactly like the first time we saw this room with one difference: the hospital Group Therapy crowd sit the room. They are oblivious to the change around them. N their pounding gradually UNIFIES, becomes a background vo like DRUMMING. Cynthia is speechless. She looks at then in amazement, bu none of them notice her. Suddenly she sees

dialogues.speaker: 75A HARRIS
dialogues.text: He's across from her, SMILING.    Again, he sleeks back h hair in that amber liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You failed me, Cynthia...   You failed all of us... Harris holds a wooden match. With it he presses back a fingernail. It snaps off and bleeds. Harris watches Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were supposed to be together... in this world... and in the next... CAMERA WIDENS to take in the cistern of liquid.    We SEE dripping wet Unity members.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was going to be perfect, all of us taking the same journey... You shouldn't have run. You made us wait for you while you slept... all those years. He presses back another nail SNAP. CAMERA WIDENS FURTHER. Now we see something we didn't see before: a dozen or so PLASTIC JERRY CANS marked "GASOLINE--DANGER--PLAMMABLE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiting time is over, my lovechild. It's time for you to join us. In Unity... Another.   SNAP.   Hands and faces everywhere are soaked. DRIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In death.    You know you want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNAP.   Drip.

dialogues.speaker: 75B CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: Her throat muscles constrict, but she can't speak. She lo over at Alan, who seems not to see any of this. Now, eyes widening in horror, Cynthia LOOKS DOWN and sees a POOL OF GASOLINE SPREADING TOWARDS HER. It washes against the pillow, her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know we're your family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNAP.   Drip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You have no choice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the match and strikes it through the pile of nai The nails scatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Come to us, Cynthia. It's time to die. Don't lot another take your place. Come to us... now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The match is lit.    He throws it off.

dialogues.speaker: SLOW MOTION
dialogues.text: It FALLS through the air. Lands on the soaked carpet.   A EXPLOSION of flames. They RUSH TOWARDS CYNTHIA--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOOOOOOO--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a blood-curdling and heart-stopping a scream as eve heard. There is a FLASH of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia's SCREAM trails off as she THROWS herself back fr the pillow. The Unity House Members and Harris are all gone. The group therapy people all turn to her in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: 77A MIRIAM
dialogues.text: Open mouthed, she DROPS the match she's holding to light cigarette. It SIZZLES on the rug. Alan STOMPS it out, rushes over to Cynthia, who SAGS in his arms,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia sits in a crumpled sprawl in Alan's office. The r is decorated in comforting tones, with Sierra Club poster and outdoors-y souvenirs. The late afternoon sun steams i through the partially closed blinds. Alan sits beside Cynthia on the couch, concerned.   Berri sucks on his pipe, makes notes. Wasserman, rocking on the legs of his chair, jots in his little notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, tense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They... they sang songs as they stacked up the white containers... they were... happy. Because it was going to be their break with the world... a world that didn't understand them. I don't remember if they took a vote or if Harris just... decided. But they all agreed. They were... happy... smiling... laughing... crying from happiness as he drenched them in the gasoline...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Jesus--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow, I... I knew it was wrong... I ran... When he threw the match, I was at the other end of the hallway... There was a flash... and a... like a wind, or the hand of God--picked me up, threw me... The ceiling fell in... When I opened my eyes... (she looks up) I was here. Hettie appears in the doorway, tray in hand, raises her eyebrows inquisitively at Alan. Alan nods immediately: He yes. Hettie comes in, gives Cynthia her medication. Wasserman closes his book, looks thoughtful. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Wasserman) If that's what happened, why didn't you find any evidence of arson? WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plastic jerry cans would've burned up before anything else... We knew there'd been an explosion... We just didn't know how or why. Berrisford stands, approaches Wasserman as the police off closes his book, moves to the doorway. BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. You must be pleased. Closing a case after... what is it, twelve years? WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says it's closed? The medical people look at him.      Cynthia's thoughts a elsewhere. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean? WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the fairy princess here woke up, she said she didn't remember anything about 32 deaths. Now she remembers they committed suicide... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: but she, of course, was innocent. Who knows what she'll remember tomorrow? Running for help... or pouring gasoline on the fire? He goes out. HETTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man's a candidate for shock therapy... with a car battery right to the cojones. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... he's right.     I am guilty. They look at her, startled. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm guilty of lying... to Unity House. I promised to be part of it... Forever. They expected me to keep my word. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
