dialogues.text: They still do. She stands, goes out. Alan and Hettie look worried. Berrisford looks... unsurprised. He turns to Alan. BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Alan. Still think she doesn't belong in the group? Alan just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, in her bathrobe, wanders out of the shower in between the dark, steamy rows of lockers. She passes Lana and Miriam. Miriam is dressing, and Lana is putting on a swimsuit. MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing like a hot shower, huh? Cynthia doesn't hear or see them. She settles on the far of the bench. She sits there blankly. Lana nears, with great trepidation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia?   Cynthia?   Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cynthia looks up. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?    After that session today, I-- CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Cynthia starts to dress, ignoring Lana.         Lana stan for a moment, very awkwardly. LANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... you're a decent person... not a... mean spirited witch like some people... She thrown a look at Miriam, who just smiles pleasantly. LANA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and, well, if you need a friend here... CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant tone) All my friends are dead. Rattled, Lana backs off, on the verge of tears, rushing p Miriam, who has observed all this. MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana, wait a minute, she didn't mean it--shit. Miriam closes her locker and comes over to Cynthia. MIRIAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Lana's a mealy-mouthed little prude, but she means well. I probably pull her chain too much... She's reaching out, like all of us. Try and help her. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't even help myself. Miriam looks at her, puzzled, then exits the locker room, heading back to the ward.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beyond the lockers, through a doorway, we see Lana loweri herself into the pool. Blue ripples line the wall beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (echo affect)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be cleansed! The SOUND of the VOICES unnerves Cynthia.     She presses hands against her forehand in pain. We are TIGHT ON Cynthia.    We hear SPLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleanse the heart of your mind. A bright white light melts across Cynthia's face.     She up. Something draws her forward.

dialogues.speaker: 80A CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: She begins walking, passing behind CLOTHES RACKS and LOCK Then, somehow, the SHADOWS of these things become the SHA of TREES, and then Cynthia is

dialogues.speaker: 80B ON A BROAD FIELD
dialogues.text: which leads down to a POND. Twenty or so PEOPLE are gathe at the edge of the water. We see the Unity House in the distance. Cynthia moves behind a tree to watch. Harris stands waist deep in the pond. The Unity House Members all sit or stan on the shore. Harris holds his hands out in a gesture. A girl comes forward through the group out into the water. is Cynthia, the younger Cynthia, with long hair in a brai She smiles at Harris as she nears him. He clutches her hands. Behind the tree, Cynthia watches "herself," absorb Harris looks into Cynthia's eyes.    He touches her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia.     You are part of the whole. He grabs her by the back of the head and plunges her violently under water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleanse the heart of the mind! He yanks her up.   She smiles exultantly.    He dunks her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleanse the soul of the self! He yanks her up again, but it's not Cynthia. It's LANA. Before she can catch her breath, she's plunged back down.

dialogues.speaker: 80C LANA
dialogues.text: She's yanked up, but this time she's not in the pond, she in that gasoline-filled cistern!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleanse the spirit of the body! He holds her under. She starts to move her arms around to grab hold of something to pull herself up, but Harris is strong. She flails around desperately.

dialogues.speaker: 80D CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: Alarmed, she moves forward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleanse the spirit. Lana's gasping, inhaling water, turning blue.    Harris i possessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleanse. Her movements slow.   Her eyes close.   She is completely still.

dialogues.speaker: 80F HARRIS
dialogues.text: He looks directly at Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warned you, Cynthia. I warned you someone else would take your place.

dialogues.speaker: 80G UNDER WATER AGAIN
dialogues.text: His HAND withdraws from Lana. Her eyes OPEN. No life ther

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We're in the clinic's swimming pool! On the edge of the pool, Cynthia SCREAMS, drops to her knees in horror.

dialogues.speaker: 80H OTHER END OF BUILDING
dialogues.text: The clinic CUSTODIAN and some staff run into the room.

dialogues.speaker: 80I SWIMMING POOL
dialogues.text: Someone wades out to Lana's body, drags it to the concret deck, tries futilely to pump life back into it. Across the pool, Cynthia flails at the people trying to h her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT on Cynthia's arm as a clear liquid is injected into vein. We WIDEN, see Berrisford has injected her. Alan watches, concerned. Cynthia flails on the bed, already reacting to the sedati qualities of the drug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --He killed her--he killed her because I broke my word... He said he'd take someone else, and he did... She wanted my help... my friendship... That's why... he took her... She's out cold. Behind the doctors, in the doorway, the other clinic patients press close, curious. Hettie pushes them out and down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it, people, this ain't a sideshow... Get back to your rooms... Alan looks down at Cynthia with genuine concern.    But Berrisford eyes her totally clinically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking aloud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She's a textbook specimen from a collective environment, an immersion philosophy, run by an extremely manipulative figurehead with Messianic delusions. Unity House at its apex must have been a classic matrix of belief impression overlaid on collectivity-- (exciting himself) That would indicate she's symptomatic of a hypothetical Borderline Personality syndrome among cult followers, all externalizing their anxiety! (turning) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks at him disbelievingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) I think she's fucking freaked out about Lana!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a shrug) Possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients file past the nurse's station, taking their from Hettie. They look unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Ralph) Did you see the swimming pool this morning? The cops are all over it... Fingerprints, photographs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next they'll send in the fucking coast guard. Lot of good it'll do Lana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE SMASHES his fist on the counter, denting it.    Hettie at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, we're gonna start billing you for these outbursts.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ralph just crumples his medication cup and throws it towa her. She glares at him, doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: 88A NEARBY
dialogues.text: Cynthia and the other women from the group sit in a waiti area. Connie sits in a sunbeam, looking ethereal. Gilda i nearby, unmoving... tear stains on her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drowning isn't so bad... I remember when I died in Atlantis... It was like failing asleep. You know what's bad? Burning. When I was in the great Fire of London, well, let me tell you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing this, Cynthia chokes back a sob, jumps up and lea the room. Miriam whirls on Connie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie, I don't know about your previous lives, but in this one, you're a shithead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is on the bad, crying. Miriam comes in, sits besi her... Cynthia jumps at the weight on the bad, calms when she sees who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you can't blame yourself. Lana was an unhappy girl. Sometimes unhappy girls do foolish things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't kill herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Unity House. He comes to me, Miriam. He talks to me. He reminds me that I was supposed to go with them that night-- MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with them-- CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the fire. To the next world. They waited while I was in a coma... He told me that if I didn't join him, he would take someone also... and he did it, Miriam, he did it! Miriam gets up, her face a mixture of sympathy... sympath and something else. She lights a cigarette. Involuntarily Cynthia FLINCHES at the spark. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...   you don't believe me, do you? MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe that you believe it. And I also believe that shooting you up every time you get the heebie- jeebies ain't gonna do shit for your real problems. We gotta get you out of here--get you to some nice place at the beach or the mountains where you can fight your demons in your own way. Right? CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know anyone.   I don't have any money. MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) And you have money, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. Despite popular opinion to the contrary, I have not always been the career borderline psychotic neurotic that I am today. Up until a coupla years ago I was a writer, a reporter, a damn good one too... Hell, I really kicked some ass with that Selectric... She seems lost in thought for a moment. Unconsciously, sh scratches her wrist... a wrist where we notice for the fi time a PURPLE SCAR across the veins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was on the staff of a magazine... Well, some people called it a rag, but it was home: ME! Magazine. You heard of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head, diplomatic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in a coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Well, when they took me off to the funny farm, Saul--he's the editor--he said I was always welcome back. Maybe this is the time. See, if I can go to him, tell him your story, I could get a big advance... I'd share it with you, and we'd be set! I mean, girl, your story has everything... death, hospitalization, weird rituals, maybe a little romance-- I've seen all those longing glances between you and Goldman-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and now with poor Lana we got a little mystery. Hell, you're not an article, you're a goddamned mini- series!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...   I don't know... MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, let me be honest. This is a great story, and it means a second chance for me, so, okay, there's some self interest here. But I really think you need to tell people about Unity House... about the way decent ideas and dreams got twisted into something sick and poisonous. You owe it to the world. You owe it to yourself. It's your life, and you have to ask yourself how you want to live it... (sharper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --if you want to live it. Cynthia turns, mind made up. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia walks along with Miriam towards the banks of elevators. MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know a way to make a phone call. We'll have you out of here tonight. Miriam suddenly stops, almost paralyzed with anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia.    This is the right thing to do. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh.     Mum's the word. Alan is coming down the hallway towards them.   They move towards the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Ladies. Good to see you socializing, Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (to Miriam) See you later. And...     thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Miriam then gets into the elevator.         The doors rem Alan turns to Cynthia. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. He heads off in the opposite direction. Cynthia watches h She turns back towards Miriam. Miriam is alone in the elevator except for one other person. Miriam smiles and waves. Cynthia smiles and waves. From behind Miriam, Harris, all burned and puffy, smiles waves. The elevator doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Alan whirls around.       Cynthia rushes to the elevator. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam!    Stop! She bangs on the buttons. She pounds on the doors. in the corridor turns to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He starts to approach.   She runs to a stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia sprints down a flight.    She goes out onto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia runs to the elevator and pounds on the button, bu the elevator car has already passed. CYNTHIA (yelling into the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam, get out! She races back to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flies down the steps.    We can hear ALAN tailing her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia! She swings around a turn into a flight and trips.     Sud she's ROLLING DOWN A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SLAMS into a tree.   We see the Unity House in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia! ANOTHER VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's trying to get away! There are PEOPLE pounding through the brush all around he She gets up and runs along the path into the forest. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia! We want you to stay with us! You mustn't be afraid! She is in total panic, running blindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Branches thrash her face. She can barely see where she is going, but she comes to a halt when she reaches a dark precipice, a cliff which seemingly has no bottom--just bl as night. The people are getting nearer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see someone nearing through the brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No pain, Cynthia. There's no pain. Come with us. Share with us. Take my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia looks down the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia backs away. She starts lowering herself down, try to get footing. Some rocks slide out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, take my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Orderly rushes to her, but she wavers dizzily and FAL down the half-flight. She's dazed, but she becomes alert when she sees the orderly approaching. She picks herself and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets to the elevator. The door is just closing, but i opens again against a purse--Miriam's purse. The elevator empty. Cynthia whips around looking for her. Orderlies an nurses are moving towards her. At the opposite and of the hallway, a window is broken. Cynthia runs to it. There is a WOMAN'S SCREAM from the street below. PEOPLE YELLING. Cynthia looks out and down. We know what she sees.    She covers her face.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: An orderly takes hold of her. She is docile now, almost weak. Alan runs up. He looks out the window. So does a Nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse crosses herself.    Cynthia is escorted away am confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA IS MOVING FORWARD, TOWARDS the window. It seemingly goes OUT THROUGH THE WINDOW. The FRAME is filled with bright blue sky. Silence, except for a slight BREEZE. Someone is falling through the sky.       It is MIRIAM. We see her CLOSER, flowing down, the wind rushing up roun her. She is happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, it's really quite beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground comes rushing up and we SLAM into it. BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a session.    It's a wake.   Cynthia sits, face shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want us all now. They want us with them. Whether we like it or not, we're going,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, we're all upset by what's happened. But let's not get--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris promised us eternal bliss on the other side when we're all together. CONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eternal bliss.... RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eternal bullshit--! CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam was going to write a story about me. He killed her because she was going to help me got out of here. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, please... CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not listening to me! He wants us all to die! He wants you all with them, and it's because of me! (sobbing) It's all because of me... Berrisford addresses a pack of about thirty REPORTERS and PHOTOGRAPHERS and CAMERAMEN. FIRST REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Berrisford, what would you call two suicides on your promises so close together? BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd call it a tragic coincidence. Unfortunately, Borderline Personality Disorder is indicative of a pre-existing disposition towards suicidal tendencies. SECOND REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the commune girl? Has she confirmed that the fire was some sort of mass suicide? BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As that is a police matter, I am not at liberty to comment on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of the police, doctor, isn't it true that they suspect that the recent deaths may not have been suicides at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's completely absurd.   Where do you get this nonsense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a smug smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Lieutenant Wasserman. He confirmed to me that he's assigning some of his officers to the hospital grounds until further notice. Pandemonium as the other reporters seize this information

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rapid fire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Berrisford, are you cooperating with the police? Dr. Berrisford, do your patients have a history of violence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... I have work to do.    No further questions. And--flustered for once--he leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is raining.   Cynthia sits in bed, in the dark. We see the CHARRED AND BURNED HARRIS sitting across the r in a shadow. Cynthia looks over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in pain, Cynthia. He reaches up to his face, and peels off some skin.    It CRACKLES and oozes. He peels off more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your pain is my pain. We share it all, because we have our love.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Our love will never die. Don't make me take another of your friends. Keep your promise, lovechild. Join me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands, fumbles for the switch, knocks over a glass, turns on the light. He is gone. As she stands there in shock, a HAND touches shoulder, spins her around. She GASPS-- It's Alan, who's just opened the door.        He looks at worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want you to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sways, dizzy, sags in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like I was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie is sitting on her bad. She takes her pills from Hettie dutifully. Ed comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me at feeding time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his meds from her, smiling. CHEWS THEM loudly an sloppily until she grimaces and goes out. Then, the minute the door closes, Ed and Connie are in ea other's arms. They kiss like characters in a Harlequin Romance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming up for air) Why didn't you tell me before that you were a Prince of Ancient Atlantis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It slipped my mind ...    your Highness.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She kisses him passionately again.    He breaks the clinc pulls her towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll have bed check soon.   I know a better place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan site on the counter across from Cynthia's bed.    He with the hinged mirror on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if you want to hear this or not, and frankly, I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he toys with the mirror, we see a CANTED REFLECTION of first Cynthia and then the hallway. A nurse passes by.

dialogues.speaker: 109A ON CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: As she listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are no more responsible for those deaths twelve hours ago than you are for the ones twelve years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something catches her eye.

dialogues.speaker: 109B IN THE MIRROR
dialogues.text: Connie and Ed walk by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking otherwise is putting you in a self-replicating spiral of depression. And that puts me in a bind... What do I do, write more prescriptions? You need to face reality, not get medicated out of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia GASPS.    HARRIS HAS APPEARED IN THE MIRROR, foll Ed and Connie.

dialogues.speaker: 109C BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Cynthia jumps up, heads for the door.    Alan catches her the wrist,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Cynthia, you can't run away from this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Harris--he's going to do something to Connie--to Ed--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan SLAPS her.    She pales... tries to hit him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! Get mad--get angry--but not at me--at these fantasies--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands on rocky feet, unsure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie and Ed come to a door marked "Utility." Ed looks around cautiously and opens the door, relieved that it's still unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once inside the small space, he kisses Connie. He pulls o a pint flask of schnapps from his bathrobe pocket. He giv her a swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistful) Nectar from the grapes of Atlantis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fooling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads her back to a door that's labeled "DANGER: Authorized Personnel Only." The lock is busted open. in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are metal grating steps leading up to a platform th sits adjacent to a huge spinning turbine, its six-foot bl WHIRRING at top speed. Air ducts lead in and out of the space. Connie is uplifted, frightened, exhilarated. Their clothe and hair are blown around. They ascend the platform, and across from each other. They each take a swig. They kiss softly, spiritually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the utility room CLOSES.   It LOCKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie and Ed stare into each other's eyes.   They are lo The CAMERA MOVES IN AND OUT between and around them, exploring the depth of their absorption. The CAMERA MOVES TOWARDS the huge spinning turbine. Its SOUND builds to a tremendous ROAR. We see Connie and Ed through the door into the turbine ro The door is pulled closed by someone or something. The kn locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia keeps looking at the door, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam and Lana were both deeply disturbed women. Miriam tried to kill herself before. Lana was obsessed with the morbid... You heard her in the sessions. You can't twist what they did into something other than what it was. Just then, all the lights go OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, he stumbles towards the light, flicks it Nothing. The door OPENS. In the dim light of the hallway emergency lamps, we SEE Cynthia go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Cynthia, come back--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to follow, he COLLIDES With some furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness and confusion. Cynthia passes by the CAMERA. A moment later Alan comes by, looking for her. Other patien come out and wonder. Flashlights. A NURSE streams by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just overloaded circuits. Everyone, please go back into your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA ADJUSTS to show an elderly, skeletal custodian, ED on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turbine room upstairs? All right. (he hangs up) We'll set it straight in a minute. Somethin's caught in the turbine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar comes up to the utility door, but it won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a low passageway between floors. Edgar has to sto under the ducts and pipes. He comes to a small hatchway i the coiling above him marked "CAUTION: Turbine." There is a latch which has to be pulled to release the hatchway. Edgar pulls. It's stuck. He yanks with his frai body. The latch barely moves. A TRICKLE OF BLOOD streams out at the edge, but Edgar doe see it. Edgar yanks and pulls with all his might, groaning and heaving. Finally he stops in frustration. He sits an a duct, resting. Just then the latch undoes itself. The hatchway slams ope Edgar is showered with red lumpy fluid. He is coated with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar looks down. In the pool of red is a woman's shoe. Puzzled, he bends down, picks it up. Something FALLS OUT IT.

dialogues.speaker: 121A ON THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: It is a SEVERED HUMAN FOOT.

dialogues.speaker: 121B ON EDGAR
dialogues.text: as he reacts in shock, the spinning turbine begins to SPLATTER DROPS OF BLOOD on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia comes towards us.       Alan, further down the ha her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia turns, reacts...       and then reacts to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia.   Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes into another corridor. Alan hurries to catch up, but then has to help a nurse with a frightened OLDER WOMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia moves down the hall a bit.       She looks up at coiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, we're up here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the hall further, another vent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with us, Cynthia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must join us, Cynthia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia follows the voices. She is underneath another lar vent with a fan spinning inside. Everyone in the hall ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, you must reach out and embrace our love for you... You must reach out to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Harris now, behind the fan, in brief flashes of li burnt then normal, gazing down at Cynthia. He reaches towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are Connie and Ed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His fingers ARE SLICED OFF BY THE FAN.       He takes no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're with us now.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We hear SPLASHING. Cynthia looks over. Gallons of blood a solid matter pour out of the ceiling vents all down the h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they? (she is frantic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are Connie and Ed?   Where are they? Alan wonders at the pouring red, then he hears Cynthia screaming. He runs down the hall to stop her. The patients and nurses watch the blood pour in horror. Cynthia is getting more and more hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are Connie and Ed? Alan corners her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right--it's all right-- Suddenly, out of nowhere, a BL00D-COVERED BODY careens in them, driving them apart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Edgar, covered with blood, in a total state of shock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --horrible--sweet Jesus--help me-- Alan struggles to restrain him.   Nurses run to help.

dialogues.speaker: 123B CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: Huddles on the floor in a position not unlike the one fro her coma. She SOBS uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and an orderly escort Cynthia to her room. Alan come out, watches Edgar pass by in a wheelchair, raving. Ralph and Gilda come up to Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Ed and Connie.    They're dead, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks at her.       How did the grapevine got it to fast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. We're not sure what happened... There was evidence that they were drinking... They fell into... the main turbine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck... Look, Ed drank before. Lots of times. Didn't know that, did you? But he didn't usually decide to jump into a mix master, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, as for your own safety, you are being given the most amount of protection possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are powerless.    Ask Cynthia. She knows. (softly) Harris wants us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph looks at Gilda with almost as much dismay as Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Fucking Christ!    I'm getting the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ralph moves along, a paunchy POLICEMAN intercepts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Wasserman assigned me to you. Where you go--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the picture. Try not to shoot me or your fat ass, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The newscast continues silently on the TV in her room. is getting dressed. She peaks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Policeman assigned to her is down the hall a ways, chatting with a nurse. Cynthia slips out and down the corridor. She waits for an elevator. When a door opens, she tries t inconspicuously slip inside but she finds herself face to face with Alan who in just getting out of the elevator. H holds a grocery bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this a coincidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her arm and starts leading her back to her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, this is the safest place for you to be. The police are here. There are doctors here. And I'm going to keep you company, all night. I even brought provisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows a variety of fast food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure unadulterated junk. At this point, who cares about the chemicals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles slightly. He holds his arm out for her like a swain escorting his date. She takes it in a similar spiri

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The policeman comes out of Cynthia's room, looking for he alarm. He's instantly relieved to see her there with Alan Alan directs her inside. She goes. Alan gives the Policem a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try harder next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into her room, leaving the embarrassed cop behind Suddenly the LIGHTS RETURN with an eye-jarring FLASH. The cop has his revolver halfway out of the holster before he realizes what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both react   to the returned power with relief. Alan takes the stuff   out of the bag: chips, dips, cookies, s packs of beer.    He offers some of the chips. She shakes head. The TV's    still on. Alan switches channels with t sound muted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with frightening casualness) Connie and Ed aren't going to be the last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they are. Everyone's under protection. Nothing can happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pointing upwards. An outstretched hand SLAMS itself down, the blade impaling through the palm. The hand squirms its fingers a bit, then pulls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up clenching the perforated hand. He is very calm He closes the knife and puts it in a drawer. Suddenly, violently, he kicks a trash bin.      Then he i again. Ralph's assigned Policeman pokes his head in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ralph sticks his hand behind him.       He is very friend normal. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you, officer. Hey, lemme buy you a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Sounds good to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph comes out of his room. Ralph's policeman is beside him. His hand bleeds, but goes unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan lies back in front of the TV, eyes closed, SNORING. Sympathetic, Cynthia slips the remote control from his hand... then there is a KNOCK at the door. She goes there finds Ralph, who steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his cop) Just a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just came to tell you-- (smiling, conspiratorially) Everything's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into the bathroom and rinses his blood-soaked han Cynthia sees this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Everything's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is mystified.    He goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph walks off, his Policeman following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling down the hall) Ralph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes in and pokes Alan awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph was just here.   His hand was... all bloody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go to the door and they are immediately faced with Hettie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Goldman, have you seen Ralph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to ask you the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up a paper cup with a tablet in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't take his four o'clock. If he misses this one, I'm gonna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan takes the capsule, examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! It's his tranquilizer! If he doesn't take this, he'll completely flip out--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Cynthia run down the hall.     Cynthia's policem follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Cynthia and the policeman scan for Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Every five or six feet along in a line, there is a modera sized droplet splatter of blood. They follow the droplets along the hallway. They follow the droplets through a set of double doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph walks along, his policeman trailing.        No one around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you know where you're going? Ralph stops suddenly and turns to him. Ralph smiles warml Suddenly he hits the cop in the head using two fists. The cop falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Cynthia's policeman move down the hall, followin the drops, scanning in doorways. Cynthia is just behind them. These hallways are unused.       Nobody around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he behaving strangely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more strangely than everybody also in this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get him. He must be shut off.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They pass an open freight elevator.       Cynthia looks i stops. There is a droplet of blood on the floor inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLOODY HAND reaches out of the elevator covering her mo and pulls her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph holds her, slams the gate closed, and flips the swi The car moves down. Cynthia SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and the policeman rush up just as the car disappears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They descend.       She wipes blood from her face.   He l wired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, we have to go and get your medication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly moves to the control panel. He watches her. Ju as she is about to reach the buttons, he violently pushes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator comes down to a stop. Ralph throws the door open. It is a huge dark space, a vast store room. Cynthia won't come out. Ralph gestures politely.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, I'm not going out.    We have to go back upstairs. Ralph grabs her firmly and pulls her out. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, please! RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to you. He leans in the elevator, opens the control panel and yan some wires. Sparks fly. The HUM of the elevator motor die Cynthia is panicked. RALPH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very, very, very, very, very important that I talk to you. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, you're not being yourself. Can't you tell? RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   This is the real me! He flies across the basement and, grabbing a chair, smash the control box for the electric cargo door, the only oth entrance. He darts up a storage aisle.      He rips a phone off the RALPH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come down here a lot. It helps me unwind. Cynthia can't see him. He wildly paces up and down the storage aisles. Cynthia starts to cry. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, please! How do we get out? RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been said by better men than me in better ways in better times-- there is no way out! She goes to a barred window. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ralph goes into a rage. He pushes over a huge storage she Everything spills and breaks. Amid the rubble a pile of surgical blades lies glinting in a pool of light. Ralph looks down at it. Cynthia sees him looking at it. She is afraid. He grabs some of the blades randomly and disappears. He is walking crazily up and down the storage aisles. Cynthia only catc glimpses of him. He jumps up and breaks the individual LI BULBS which hang on wires, providing the only illuminatio The space grows DARKER. All the while, Ralph talks and talks. RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are only a few chances for real glory, and most people fuck it up. Most people can't even find the noses on their fucking faces. (jump, BREAK) You want an example? How about EVERY FUCKING DOCTOR in this entire hospital? Do you think I'm just going to let myself slowly dissolve into nothingness here?! (jump, BREAK) I'm talking about a glorious glory. And everybody's trying to drag me down! CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, please, they said you have to take some pills. RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pills have got nothing to do with it! You know what I'm talking about! He jumps, smashes the last bulb.   She can't see him. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't. I don't. RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do! Real glory, hallelujah! The great big gig in the sky. Don't play dumb, Cynthia. She sees him at the far and of the aisle. His shirt is of There are deep, bleeding cuts all over his chest and stom He has blades clenched in both fists.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cynthia is terrified. RALPH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you know the word I'm searching for. He starts making deep slashes on his arm. RALPH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U, N, I, T, Y! Unity! CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Ralph! No! RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, oh, yes! Eternal bliss! He stops and raises the scalpels to his chest.   He jabs in and cuts open down to his stomach. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, please, stop! He swats at the one remaining lamp. It flickers on and of Ralph's eyes flutter. He FALLS. Cynthia rushes to him. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph! He throws a scalpel at her.   It misses, but she is spatt with blood. RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fading) Get back. Cynthia is crouched down, crying as she watches him. RALPH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join us, Cynthia. The light flickers off, then on.   A hand is on Cynthia's shoulder. She looks up... it is Harris. HARRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join us. The bulb DIES.   Blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasserman rushes in, raincoat over a pajama shirt and chi slacks. Another POLICEMAN rushes to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in the basement.   The girl's alive. They run on together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of COPS, a few DOCTORS and ORDERLIES.    Alan is sto by a FEMALE COP. He looks into the basement area and sees Ralph in a pool blood. A POLICE PHOTOGRAPHER is taking pictures of him. Alan stares at Ralph. Berrisford is with Cynthia and a nurse.    Cynthia is get an injection. Wasserman comes over to Alan and Berrisford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're running out of patients, Doctors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she say happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's having a little trouble with reality--as usual. A nurse and an orderly escorts Cynthia towards the elevat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Alan. Thanks for trying. But it's time for me to go now. Alan suddenly realizes what she means.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go with her.    Where is she being taken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isolation. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Isolation? Are you out of your mind? That girl needs human contact--connection--isolation is the worst thing you can do-- BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Goldman, I know you're fond of the girl, but you're out of line. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. You want her on the edge, don't you... You want to play your theory out to the end--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldman! WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested) Theory? Anything I should know? BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an extraordinarily complex situation, severe identity crisis compounded with the multiple shock of these deaths. She's reverting to this total belief system from the commune through an intermittent psychosis that puts ideology above her life itself-- ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck ideology! Fuck you, Berrisford! You can't use a human being as a guinea pig-- (to Wasserman) You have to stop this. Call it off--I'll--I'll sign her into police custody if I can stay on as her physician--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Goldman. I believe your tenure with my clinic has just come to an end. (calling off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security? Would you please escort Dr. Goldman off the premises?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is escorted through the hospital by the nurse and policeman. She moves without resistance, without emotion. We hear CRICKETS. Cynthia hovers in a dreamlike calm. The hospital is a blur as they move through it. Objects pass in front of our view as we TRACK with her. Cynthia, the nurse, and the policeman walk up the path to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The imposing facade of the old Victorian with its warmly windows looks inviting. The three make their way over the lawn up the path towards the front porch. An evening BREE is just coming up. Cynthia looks around, absorbing the environment. The policeman and the nurse say nothing. Cynthia turns to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. Cynthia steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is closed. It is dark. A video camera hovers above. We hear keys L0CKING a bolt. Cynthia stand there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time, Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse puts her keys in her pocket, looks at the policeman, and goes. The policeman stays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, carrying a carton of personal items, Alan storms towards the exit. The security guard rises to intercept h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Excuse me, Dr. Goldman? (apologetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to ask you for your key card. (apologetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Berrisford's orders. I'm sorry. Burning, Alan shifts his package, finds the card, flings down on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Berrisford he can use it for a bookmark. Maybe then he can find his dick without a road map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna miss you around here, Dr. Goldman. Alan manages a smile for the man, goes out.

dialogues.speaker: A DIM, FUZZY VIDEO IMAGE
dialogues.text: FOCUS DOWN until we realize it is Cynthia lying in her be We are looking at her from directly above. We WIDEN, real that we're at a NURSE'S STATION, where Cynthia is monitor along with other patients. We can see that she is talking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only illumination comes from a small lamp near Cynthi bed. She seems comparatively alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were always the favorite.    We love you. Come with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of us together, that's all we've ever wanted, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing it to everybody else? Why don't you kill me?

dialogues.speaker: 154A ON HARRIS
dialogues.text: His index finger is AFLAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the whole room now. It's filled with Unity House Members, all of them. They're sitting leaning, slumping everywhere in the shadows. Among them are Connie and Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to do it yourself, honey. When you didn't... he took us instead. But we're not mad. It's wonderful here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death is like this really beautiful trip Cynthia. We just want to share it with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana and Miriam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mustn't be afraid, Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris in playing with his burning finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if I can do it, you can do it, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE notices Cynthia's movement on the screen.       S the volume up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just kill me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse gets up. Gilda is standing there.        She fo Gilda's policeman lurks nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to join us because you love us. You have to do it for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the Nurse UNLOCKING the door. A MALE UNITY MEMBER looks over at the door.       We seem momentarily burned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to do it for yourself-- (smiling) --lovechild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Harris momentarily burned.       He blows his fing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm so scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nurse opens the door.    The room is empty except for Cynthia on her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to call the doctor, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to sleep, all right?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gilda rushes in behind the Nurse, going to Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) I can do nothing for you now, but know this--the answer you seek is inside of you! It is inside you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilda's Policeman comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls at Gilda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she goes) Know yourself and you will be at peace! It is so!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nurse SLAMS the door closed.    Cynthia is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilda's policeman is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm taking her back to her room... Okay, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, looks around.    Gilda is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are FOLLOWING GILDA through the corridors back to her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilda's policeman is still looking for her.      She's no sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilda comes in and lies down.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Momentary silence. A shaft of light hits Gilda as someone comes in the door. Whoever it is nears Gilda. She is calm. She looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you'd come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up a bottle of tablets.       We fleetingly see "poisonous." The bottle SMASHES to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON HER
dialogues.text: She looks like she's been crying.       She stares off in Someone crosses in the shadows to the window. The rubber edging is slit with a scalpel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels good. I know this is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. You need our love. We need your love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadowed hand pushes on the plexiglass.       The windo plops onto the pavement below. A breeze wafts in. Cynthia gets out of bed and comes to the window. She look out onto the evening horizon, refreshed, fully experienci the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this is right.   We'll all be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan comes out, still fuming. He walks along a ways and t looks at the illuminated SIGN pointing out the way to the "Berrisford Clinic." Alan stares at it, then in a sudden release of fury, KICKS it, once, twice, and then he THROW his carton at it. Calming, feeling like an idiot, he sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliant. Do we feel better now? No. Yes. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thought strikes him.    He reaches into his shirt pocke takes out--

dialogues.speaker: 171B TRANQUILIZER
dialogues.text: --the one Hettie handed to Alan two long and bloody hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a shrug) It's okay, officer. I'll write myself a prescription in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swallows it, dry, with a loud GULP, Then he picks up h papers and things, heads for the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: 171D ALAN'S CAR
dialogues.text: PULLBACK as Alan unlocks it, his carton momentarily balan on the car roof. The door open, Alan gets in, puts his bo in the cluttered back seat. He SHIVERS from one of those unexpected chills we all get, then puts the key in the ignition, STARTS the engine, turns on the LIGHTS. Then he looks up ahead and sees--

dialogues.speaker: 171E DR. BERRISFORD
dialogues.text: Briefcase in hand, crossing the parking lot up ahead, his long shadow falling across a high retaining wall.

dialogues.speaker: 171F BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Alan sits, face unreadable.   He REVS the engine.   Faste Faster. A strange smile crosses Alan's face.   He THROWS THE CAR GEAR.

dialogues.speaker: 171G BERRISFORD
dialogues.text: He taken out his keys, approaches his car...   suddenly R as HEADLIGHTS BLIND HIM--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan ROARS TOWARDS HIM, grinning behind the wheel--

dialogues.speaker: 171I BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Berrisford gasps, RUNS!

dialogues.speaker: 171J THE CHASE
dialogues.text: Berrisford dodges in and out of cars, behind lamp posts. Manic, Alan follows him relentlessly, skidding around tur SIDESWIPING as many cars as budget allows. Finally--

dialogues.speaker: 171K BERRISFORD
dialogues.text: finds himself against a wall--as TIRES SKID in he SCREAMS

dialogues.speaker: 171L INSIDE ALAN'S CAR
dialogues.text: He SLAMS Berrisford against the wall. Berrisford's body SMACKS against the bricks, rebounds onto the windshield, CRACKING IT. Alan recoils from the impact, blood on his lips from his collision with the steering wheel. He looks at Berrisford squirming a foot away with the little life left in him. Alan CACKLES, gives Berrisford the finger. Then he throws the car into reverse.

dialogues.speaker: 171N BERRISFORD
dialogues.text: SLIDES off the car hood, hits the asphalt, his head CRACK

dialogues.speaker: 171P BERRISFORD
dialogues.text: As the car GRINDS him into the ground, his wrist bones SNAPPING, ribs CRUNCHING, body TWITCHING. Finally he is STILL. An artery SQUIRTS fountain-like into the air.

dialogues.speaker: 171Q INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: The blood hits the windshield.    Idly, distracted, Alan on the windshield wipers... Suddenly HARRIS sits up in the rear seat, a smile on the burned and scarred face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work, Dr. Goldman.   Now, it's your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skeletal hands GRAB Alan's throat.       He STRUGGLES. of the corner of his eye he sees-

dialogues.speaker: 171R FRONT OF CAR
dialogues.text: Gasoline is flowing over the dented hood and through the cracked windshield and over the dash and over Alan. More more comes.

dialogues.speaker: 171S BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Holding Alan with one hand, Harris leans forward, pulls o the cigarette lighter! He holds the GLOWING TIP up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses the burning tip against Alan's gasoline soaked CREEK. It SIZZLES--Alan SCREAMS--

dialogues.speaker: 171T CAR
dialogues.text: It EXPLODES--

dialogues.speaker: 171U ALAN
dialogues.text: He jerks his head up, face drenched in sweat. He's still his original parking space! He's never even started the c Gasping for air, still freaked, he opens the door, tumble out.

dialogues.speaker: 171V PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: The box of his possessions is still on the roof of the ca Alan sees this, staggers against the car, fights a wave o nausea. Struggling to remain composed, he takes his pulse Feels his head. Suspicion crosses his face. Then his hand moves to his shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: 171W FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: of himself taking the pill by the clinic sign.

dialogues.speaker: 171X BACK TO THE PRESENT
dialogues.text: fingers down his throat. He HEAVES his guts out beside hi car... but when he straightens up, he's clear eyed and lu He turns, runs like hell towards the clinic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RON, the pharmacist, looks up as Alan storms inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldman, you look like shit--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him aside) Show me the scrips for the therapy group--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man, I can't do that-- it's Berrisford's show all the way--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignoring him, Alan finds the files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, this is all standard stuff--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you expect? ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you fill these prescriptions? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, Berrisford does it. He comes in every morning and sets up the medication for the day--Hettie takes it as she needs it-- ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! He turns, tries to open the glass case with the prearrang trays. It's locked. He grabs a paperweight, SMASHES THE GLASS. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--! Alan pulls out the tray, scans it. He grabs Ron by the collar, shoves the files into his face. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read it.   Pesco, Ralph-- RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead-- ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: READ IT!   What's he down for? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Lithium--four times a day-- Alan grabs the tray, holds up a pill. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Lithium? RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, no--that's Endoral--the complete opposite--one of those, even a normal person would flip out-- ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alan looks at the tray and its compartments labeled for L Miriam, Ed... all the others. Alan GRABS them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this? And this?      And this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is, uh, dextroamphetamine... Christ, take one of these and you can walk on the ceiling. Holy mother. Methylphenidate! Don't mass with that fucker. Clonodine! Chlorapromazine! Preludin? Shit, I didn't know they still made that... Two of these and Mother Teresa would turn into a maniac! Alan in having convulsions of horror.

dialogues.speaker: ON MIRIAM AND LANA -
dialogues.text: they swallow medication.

dialogues.speaker: ON BERRISFORD -
dialogues.text: he pulls bottles off the pharmacy shelves.

dialogues.speaker: ON CONNIE AND ED -
dialogues.text: they swallow medication.

dialogues.speaker: ON BERRISFORD -
dialogues.text: he hands the bottles of medication to the pharmacy administrator.

dialogues.speaker: ON NURSE WITH RALPH'S PRESCRIPTION -
dialogues.text: Alan grabs it away.

dialogues.speaker: ON BERRISFORD
dialogues.text: he injects Cynthia with medication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tetrahydrocannabinol! Do you know what that is? Liquid condensed marijuana! Just thinking about that stuff gets you wasted. Alan runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Goldman, come back here! Who's gonna clean up this mess--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan running faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hettie is standing smiling in the middle of the hall. nears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to be here, Dr. Goldman, are you? Alan turns.   Two SECURITY GUARDS are coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Hettie, I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is at the window, facing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan rushes over to Cynthia's door and pounds furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia!     Cynthia! The two security guards start     running over. One of th his gun drawn. Alan wants to      run, but he sees there way out. He sticks his hands      in the air. The guards upon him. They start leading      him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes doctors got personally involved. I think it's a mistake. You've got to keep professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some rest, Goldman.   You look like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back at Hettie.    He sees a fire alarm. Suddenly, he grabs one of the Guard's guns.       He dive the wall and pulls the fire alarm. All of the Isolation Ward doors open.     BELLS and SIREN off. Red lights FLASH on and off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan runs from the guards, shooting but missing. He runs the hall in the opposite direction of Cynthia's room. He hides in a doorway. They pass. He heads back up to Cynthia's room. He grabs the cop's chair and runs into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the door and rams the metal chair log into the b latch to secure the door. SIRENS and BELLS continue. Alan looks over. The room is dark, except for the red light flashing on and off. Cynthia is crouched in the far corne by the open window. We can see that the room is otherwise empty of anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here. I want to do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going to her) No. Cynthia, please. I'm not going to be able to come back, but you have to listen! Berrisford's been tampering with the medication for everybody in the group--that's why they've been committing suicide--he's been making them crazy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Harris comes to me...   He speaks to me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drug induced psychotic state is very suggestible. All we've hearing for days is "Harris, Harris,"... so that's what we all saw... That's what I saw when I took Ralph's pill! It's all part of Berrisford's plan--he has this fucked-up theory about how you still think you're part of the Unity House, and the only way he can prove it is if you want to kill yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Alan, the dark shape of Berrisford emerges from outside the window. It is climbing inside from the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear me?! He's going to want you to kill yourself! He's recreating the whole thing for you! But you can't listen to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is getting hysterical.      Berrisford stands beh with a scalpel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Goldman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan turns around. Berrisford bashes him in the head, neatly slicing off som skin. Alan flies against the wall. The gun is knocked away. Alan writhes a little, then dips into unconsciousness, Cynthia is a basket case.     She looks at Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...   no... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berrisford comes to her and starts giving her an injectio She calms herself.     She looks at him dreamily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Harris gazing at her lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one thing matters. She touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our love.     We'll be together.   All of us. Berrisford taken Alan's gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan comes to. The ALARMS and BELLS are still ringing. Cynthia and Berrisford are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corridors are run amuck with isolation patients (the worst kind) all escaped from their rooms. Alan runs out o Cynthia's room. He is surrounded by bizarre-looking peopl screaming, singing, dancing, praying. Hettie is by the stairway helping Isolation patients exit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One at a time! No pushing!      Please do not use the elevator! Alan is frantically looking for Cynthia and Berrisford, checking everywhere, pushing open doors. The security guards are at the far end of the hallway. goes to Hettie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Berrisford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your fault! These goddamn doors won't re-lock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? He's going to kill Cynthia! Tell me where he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards see Alan.      They come after him.   He runs. Alan scans every room. He slams into patients. The guards aren't far behind. Alan turns a corner, passing a door marked "NOT AN EXIT: ROOF ACCESS." It is ajar. He goes in without the guards seeing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark, but the red lights FLASH. He runs up several flights. The landings face onto the outside with a railin open, no glass. He turns a corner.      Cynthia is there. She in perched on the outside of the railing, a serene expression on her face, the wind blowing her frail white gown. Alan freezes.      He moves towards her slowly, hands outstretched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothingly) Cynthia, take my hand... Just relax... Think about what you're doing... Stay calm... I want you to take my hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches him blankly.      She turns to someone behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan turns. There on the stair above is Berrisford, his f dancing in the flashing red light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Berrisford) You piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia lets go. Alan reaches out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: FALLING
dialogues.text: It is a dizzying spiral. We hear the WIND RUSHING up as w go FASTER AND FASTER down. We SLAM into the ground. CYNTHIA'S HEAD hits rock.

dialogues.speaker: ON HER FACE
dialogues.text: She is still. Blood drips out her nose and mouth. She is dead. We HOLD ON HER until gradually bright light pours i over her. The CAMERA LIFTS UP revealing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia rises and walks towards the house through a field the foreground. She walks up the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door. Everything is clean and fresh.      F Light. Birds CHIRPING. Harris is at the far and of the hall. There is an intense white light behind him. He is smiling beatifically. Cynth goes towards him. As she nears him, she reaches out her hands. He does too. They clasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly she FALLS. She drops and dangles in the night air against

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is unconscious.     She swings twelve stories above t pavement. The CAMERA FOLLOWS UP her arm to her hand grasped tightly Alan's hand. We CONTINUE UP TO Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia! Open your eyes!   Open your eyes!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He is over the railing holding on with his other hand. Cynthia is coming to. ALAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up! Pull yourself up so I can got a grip on you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go.     I saw it.   It's beautiful. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't see shit!       Hold on! BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eternal bliss. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!   I want to go!    Let me go! BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming forward) Let her go. She needs it. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Cynthia, Harris doesn't exist! He's dead! Look at who that is! Look at him! Look! Cynthia looks at Berrisford deliriously. He CHANGES from Berrisford to Harris with each FLASH. comes to the railing where Alan is holding on. Almost politely, he tries to undo Alan's grip. ALAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn you! Goddamn you! Alan's grip on Cynthia slips down to her fingers. BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go. Let her go and I'll forget your disobedience. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: You can stay one with me in the psychosis and cult behavior study. We'll publish our findings together-- ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Publish this, asshole! Alan SWINGS one leg up, KICKS Berrisford in the groin. Berrisford HOWLS and suddenly his calm demeanor cracks. Snarling like an animal, he stomps, claws and even bites Alan's hand. ALAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cynthia) Don't you hear him? He's trying to bribe me--but I'm not letting go! I'll go with you, but I'm not letting go! Berrisford sees the discarded gun... picks it up. He aims unsteadily... SHOOTS. Alan yanks himself out of the way. Berrisford misses. Berrisford moves closer. Raises the g= barrel at point black range towards Alan's hand. ALAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, help us! Help us both! BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be with them, Dr. Goldman, Be happy. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S...stop it... Stop it! Berrisford SHOOTS. One of Alan's finger joints is BLOWN AWAY. He SCREAMS, his grip loosens, and he SLIDES down th railing. Berrisford moves several yards to stay close... begins to POUND on Alan's mutilated hand. ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, don't let him kill you! Don't let him do this! CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unity... It... it's my destiny... I've fought it too long. Right or wrong... my death has a purpose... It will close the book. End the story.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your life has a purpose... to bring joy and happiness! You're part of my life now. That's an unfinished story, too... She looks at Berrisford viciously pounding on Alan's hand CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me up.     Stop it. She starts to climb up, but she can't. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me up! BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it's too late for that. Alan's grip on her slips down to two fingers. They CRACK. She yells from the pain. She swings in the breeze. Alan is weakening.   He is losing consciousness.   He kno is about to die. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Berrisford? Suddenly Berrisford freezes. He is paralyzed at the sight of one of the guards coming the stairs. Berrisford backs away glaring. Alan GROANS.   The guard rushes over. GUARD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus (Yelling down the stairs) Gomez, get up here! The other guard appears. They start helping Alan up by Pulling his arm. As they he him up, Berrisford, in a state of shock, backs further up wall. He leans against the wall and puts the gun to his head. He trembles. He pulls the trigger. CLICK. CLICK, CLICK, CLICK. Out of bullets. The others are too busy to be noticing what he in doing. Just as they pull Cynthia to the edge, she looks up to see:

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Berrisford coming to the railing, and jumping, calmly. Silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Cynthia numbly watches him fall.    Then she in pulled up over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is plopped over onto a gurney. Lights are passing her. She is being whisked down a hallway. She is descendi into a haze of unconsciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a detox prep! Stat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan runs alongside the gurney with doctors and nurses. H clutches bloody bandages to his hand, tries to hear Cynth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's over. It was Berrisford. He killed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then all those other things... Faces... voices? They were...      in my head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Berrisford. He shot you up with hallucinogens. What he didn't do, you imagined. There is joy through her delirium. She is just able to cl hands with him briefly before she disappears behind a set double doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new station wagon whisks along the pretty road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan drives, Cynthia looks at a map.       They both look They both have bandaged hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go right if that's the interstate. Yeah, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the greenery are the charred and overgrown remain Unity House. A chiseled sign embedded into a tree verifie it. Alan and Cynthia pull up, park. Cynthia gets out and looks around. She goes to the front entrance. Alan follow her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mere skeleton of what it was. Daylight pours in through the faded, burnt slats of wood. Patches of woods have sprouted up. Cynthia wanders in and marvels at it all. On piles of charcoal signify where furniture was. Alan meanders in from the other and of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victorian. Looks like it was a nice house once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I guess appearances can be deceiving. She moves out upstairs.       He follows her up onto the looking steps.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LANDING
