dialogues.text: She reaches a point at the top that looks out over the me and pond. She looks out. Alan joins her. Cynthia takes in the view contentedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead.     It's really dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She gestures to the house around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan smiles. He pulls her close to him. They look into ea other's eyes. Neither of them is completely at ease with other, but there is honest affection. They hug, then kiss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks almost tranquil.       MUSIC UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasserman walks along, accompanied by a uniformed officer They go into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where the doctor is in a bed, one leg and one arm in traction. He's talking to his LAWYER as the police office enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mid-speech) --letters of support could have an influence on the court... You know, from your peers--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) I have no peers. (turning) Hello, Lieutenant. (smiling) Forgive me for not getting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real funny, Doctor. Try this for laughs: As soon as you're ambulatory, you're going in front of a Grand Jury, and you're going to be charged with six counts of obstruction of justice and two counts of assault.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then it gets choice: five counts of murder in the first degree, one count of murder in the second degree. Add the civil liability to all that, and you're going to have plenty of time to write that book. BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I don't agree with your definition of justice, but I suppose I obstructed it... All in the name of science, of course-- LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appalled) Doctor Berrisford-- BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushing him) --but as to murder, well, Lieutenant, I beg to differ. I didn't kill anyone. Why would I? I'm only interested in knowledge. Cynthia is a unique girl--the product of an environment and a philosophy unrivaled in its purity. I wanted to understand the depth of her commitment, the link between psychosis and total immersion philosophies, the dark terra incognita of the human psyche-- WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fed up) Hey, go chow on a Latin dictionary, okay? You can bullshit all you want, but how do you account for six bodies? BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly some unknown variable was a factor. WASSERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, if you didn't kill off the therapy group, who did? BERRISFORD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, I'll put it in terms even a policeman can understand. He smiles, shrugs the best he can in his plaster cast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It beats the fuck out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia and Alan are still in each other's arms.        C pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just thinking about Gilda. Somehow, she knew. She kept talking about "him," but I didn't know what she meant. She said the answer was inside me. Why would she say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan doesn't have an answer.     She sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go down. I'll be out in a minute. I just want to... bury some memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.   He goes. Cynthia gives a final look around at the deteriorated structure and turns down the stairs. She stands at the top of what remains of the stairs. We FOLLOW HER DOWN. Just as she nears the bottom, the TICKING of a clock is audible. It gets LOUDER. Cynthia reaches the last stop and turns into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW HER with a CONTINUOUS PAN. The foyer is new now completely untouched by fire, just as it was at the begin of the film. A candelabrum is lit. Cynthia turns and we PAN BACK TO THE STAIRCASE. It is new unburnt. Two KIDS come scrambling down the stairs laughin The entranceway, the archway to the front room, the stair are all intact, just as we saw them in the opening scene. CYNTHIA peers into the kitchen. Two WOMEN in work aprons kneading bread dough, chopping vegetables. They smile at Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia!   Are you staying for supper? Cynthia is silent, wide-eyed, taking it all in.    She tu towards the front door. Victor is coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia.   It's good.   Come in. She in unable to resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in. The room is filled with people. There is a fire in the hearth. Children play. Candles illuminate the space. Unity Members smile and great her casually as she passes them. Miriam in talking with a BEARDED MAN intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, I'm so glad you're here. Ed and Connie are by the fireplace with some others.    T smile at Cynthia knowingly. Lana is sitting contentedly on the window seat reading wi some children. Ralph is crouched with victor in a corner.    They are la warmly.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gilda comes up to her. She is ebullient, happier, healthi looking than we've ever seen her. GILDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, it's so wonderful here, but we miss you terribly. Cynthia nears Harris. He smiles at her and kisses her. Everyone in the room turns to her. Harris holds up a shin and sharp knife with ornamentation on the handle. Cynthia doesn't see it yet. He puts the pointed tip against her chest. HARRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time, Cynthia.    It's finally time, isn't it? EVERYONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting the vision) You don't exist. HARRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say that. (he touches her) Go on. Take the knife. She can't escape his gaze. HARRIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.   You know you want to. GILDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you do, Cynthia. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see how beautiful it is. SOMEONE ELSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will. Cynthia clasps her hand around the knife at her chest, Ha lets go. She holds it there by herself, completely hypnotized by his words, by his eyes. MIRIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, we're only telling you this because we love you.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HARRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful lovechild. All will be in balance when you've joined us. All will be right when daughter is with father. SOMEONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're special, Cynthia. SOMEONE ELSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared blood... daughter of the father. Cynthia in mortified. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...? HARRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you remember. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... HARRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My own beautiful lovechild. Everyone has proven their love to me. Now you must. She is weak now.    She is about to do it. Her grasp tightens around the knife handle.      She's tr She takes a deep breath. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! She jams the knife into Harris' throat and pulls it out. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I don't! I don't love you!      I don't need you! She is crazed. She flies around the room brandishing the knife at everyone. They back off. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never loved any of you! I hate you! I hate you all! What you did was wrong!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She swats the knife at them all. Victor's arm gets cut. Gilda has to dive away from her. Cynthia is knocking over lamps and chairs in her rage. She is crying hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was WRONG! It was stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (saddened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never needed you!    Any of you! We are TIGHT ON CYNTHIA. She is winding down, crying with her face buried in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never did... She is still.    Gradually, the silence fills with a quie BREEZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia? She drops the knife. The knife is all rusty and corroded. The floor is a charred mass. Cynthia turns around. Alan comes in the front door. The room is again its empty skeletal self, blackened and silent. Cynthia is trembling. She walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands on the porch, holding onto a post, trying to c herself. Alan comes out. As he starts the car, a gust com up. The trees are thrashed around. The WIND ECHOES through the house.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC UP SOFTLY, EERILY.
dialogues.text: Cynthia descends the stairs.    The station wagon pulls u She gets inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull out. Slowly we see Cynthia collect herself. sense of hope is evident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be okay.   I'm going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car speeds off trailing dust. We see the UNITY HOUSE in the distance.     The winds kic again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are CLOSER. Branches and leaves are being tossed aroun by violent gusts as we MOVE TOWARD the structure. A teenage GIRL comes running up from the field behind. is crying. She runs into the house. We FOLLOW HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to a far corner and cries some more, angrily, hopelessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (far off) Come on, where are you? I hope you're not in that house... You always got like this and make stupid threats that you don't mean!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl peeks out the corner of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEENAGE BOY is in the field beyond.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BOY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not here on three, I'm history. Permanently. One... Two... Three! Fine. Good riddance. THE GIRL backs away from the window, only more upset now. A hand touches her shoulder.      She whirls around. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Who are you? HARRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend.    You're upset. She nods. HARRIS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say if I could promise you eternal bliss? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eternal bliss? What do you mean? TRACKING IN on the old knife an the floor. It begins to transform from its rusty and corroded state into a new an shiny knife. MUSIC UP. A burned, skeletal hand reaches INTO FRAME and takes it.
